Language: Ada  Eiffel  Euphoria  Occam  SPARK  ANSI SQL  and VHDL

Block comment: ¢ BlockComment ¢ comment BlockComment comment co BlockComment co # BlockComment # £ BlockComment £

In-line comment: ; InlineComment one example (most assembly languages use line comments only)

Language: AWK  Bash  Bourne shell  C shell  Maple  R  Tcl  and Windows PowerShell
C (K&R  ANSI/C89/C90)  CHILL  PL/I  and REXX

Block comment: /* BlockComment */ /** Documentation BlockComment */ (ddoc comments) /+ BlockComment +/ (nestable) /++ Documentation BlockComment +/ (nestable  ddoc comments)
( BlockComment ) (single line as well as multiline) ( before -- after ) stack comment convention
%{ BlockComment (nestable) %} Note: Both percent–bracket symbols must be the only non-whitespace characters on their respective lines.

Language: Pascal  Modula-2  Modula-3  Oberon  and ML:

Block comment: =begin BlockComment =cut (=end in Ruby) (POD documentation comment) __END__ Comments after end of code
#`{ BlockComment } =comment This comment paragraph goes until the next POD directive or the first blank line.[19][20]
''' BlockComment ''' """ BlockComment """ (Documentation string when first line of module  class  method  or function)

In-line comment: // InlineComment /// InlineComment ("Outer" rustdoc comment) //! InlineComment ("Inner" rustdoc comment)
Block comment: /* BlockComment */ (nestable) /** BlockComment */ ("Outer" rustdoc comment) /*! BlockComment */ ("Inner" rustdoc comment)

Language: TeX  LaTeX  PostScript  Erlang  Elixir and S-Lang

In-line comment: ' InlineComment ''' InlineComment (XML documentation comment) Rem InlineComment
